text: first of all the government has lost the
claimants who came to the court
demanding that Parliament has a say over
how we leave the European Union have won
11 judges had discussions made
agreements and the government's on the
losing side what that means is that this
case now goes across Parliament Square
to the House of Commons and MPs will
have a say on how we actually start the
process of leaving the European Union
that is what the government was
expecting and for weeks now they have
been preparing to bring laws to
Parliament to start the whole process
all that said the third really important
thing to remember is despite all the
vitriol all the nastiness all the drama
around this case it doesn't affect
whether or not we will actually leave
the European Union this case was about
how we go about beginning our divorce
with the rest of the continent but it
doesn't change the fact that the
referendum was won by those who want to
leave and that means the legal process
here despite all the drama doesn't make
a difference to the decision the country
made
